DOI service
Based on an agreement between MPDL and German National Library of Science and Technology (TIB Hannover), Max Planck researchers can assign doi’s to their scientific output (research data and grey literature). As already mentioned, this service is integrated into Edmond and Keeper, but doi assignment is also possible for items stored in local repositories.
 
 
Requirements to request a DOI via the MPDL service:
  • persistent accessibility of registered content – users are responsible for reporting changing URLs to MPDL
  • objects feature quality scientific content
  • the landing page with metadata (not necessarily the object itself) is (and will remain) publicly accessible
  • no DOI has been assigned before [for peer-reviewed scientific papers, books or book chapters, publishers generally assign a DOI]
